subject: ATTN: Beneficiary Ronald
body:
ATTN: Beneficiary Ronald 
 
This is to notify you that your approved beneficiary funds have been deposited with a prime bank in New York USA after deliberation by the World Bank and United Nations regarding the beneficiary funds payment approved on your behalf.currently been held at the (All Citizens Bank & Trust New York USA) 
 
Process of WIRE TRANSFER the payer is paid by Bank transfer or international debit card ATM CARD.will take three working business days are required for the transfer to become effective. Fill out the informations below. 
 
It was decided that your approved beneficiary funds payment to be deposited into a prime bank rather than moved into the Government treasury and declared forfeited. 
 
Your full Name: 
Home Address . 
Phone Number /Age . 
 
This is to give you an opportunity to receive your approved beneficiary funds payment on your acceptance and reply. 
You will be provided with further details. 
 
Dr.LEON CILLIAN 
Finance Department Director 
International Monetary Fund 
Phone Number:  (210)489 1168

subject: Re: ATTN: Beneficiary Ronald
body:
Hello Cillian,

Thank you for reaching out and providing this information. It's quite interesting to hear about the funds being deposited with Prime Bank in New York, USA. I'm curious, how was it decided that my approved funds payment would be deposited into Prime Bank rather than moved into the Government treasury? 

Also, could you please provide more details about the process of wire transfer? You mentioned it takes three working business days for the transfer to become effective. Is there any specific reason for this timeline?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best regards.

Best wishes,
Ronald

subject: Re: ATTN: Beneficiary Ronald
body:
Hello Cillian,

Thank you for reaching out and sharing this information with me. It's quite interesting to hear about the funds being deposited with Prime Bank in New York, USA. I'm curious, how was it decided that my approved funds payment should be deposited into Prime Bank rather than moved into the Government treasury? 

Also, could you please provide more details about the process of wire transfer? You mentioned it takes three working business days for the transfer to become effective. Is there any specific reason for this time frame?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best regards.

Best wishes,
Ronald

subject: ATTN: Beneficiary Ronald
body:
ATTN: Beneficiary Ronald, 
 
 
The bank in the US is the appointed payment bank saddled with the responsibility of releasing your payment once you follow due process of opening a Non Resident account with the bank. 
 
The process to be followed is that you must open a Non Resident account with All Citizens Bank and Trust in the US where the fund is domiciled. 
After opening of the Non Resident account with the bank in US. 
 
An access login password and username will be sent to you to do the transfer yourself anywhere or country you reside to any of your choice account. 
This process will take a period of 72 working hours to be done, completed and your payment transferred to your destination account. 
 
Notify us to proceed on your readiness and acceptance to follow due process. 
 
Your full Name: 
Home Address . 
Phone Number /Age . 
 
This is to give you an opportunity to receive your approved beneficiary funds payment on your acceptance and reply. 
You will be provided with further details. 
 
Dr.LEON CILLIAN 
Finance Department Director 
International Monetary Fund 
Phone Number:  (210)489 1168

subject: Re: ATTN: Beneficiary Ronald
body:
Hello Cillian,

Thank you for your detailed explanation. It sounds like a straightforward process to open a Non Resident account with All Citizens Bank and Trust in the US. I appreciate your guidance on this matter.

I do have a few follow-up questions, if you don't mind. What are the requirements for opening such an account? Are there any fees associated with it? And how long does it usually take to receive the access login password and username?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best regards.

Best wishes,
Ronald

subject: Re: ATTN: Beneficiary Ronald
body:
Hello Cillian,

Thank you for your detailed explanation. It sounds like a straightforward process to open a Non Resident account with All Citizens Bank and Trust in the US. I'm quite intrigued by this opportunity.

Could you please provide more information about the Non Resident account? What are the benefits of having such an account? Also, how long does it usually take to set up this type of account?

I appreciate your assistance and look forward to hearing from you soon.

Best regards.

Best wishes,
Ronald

subject: Re: ATTN: Beneficiary Ronald
body:
Hello Cillian,

Thank you for your detailed explanation. It sounds like a straightforward process to open a Non Resident account with All Citizens Bank and Trust in the US. I'm curious, though, why is it necessary to open this specific type of account? 

Also, could you please provide more information about how long the process usually takes? You mentioned it will take a period of working hours, but I'm not sure what that means exactly.

I appreciate your help and look forward to hearing from you soon.

Best regards.

Best wishes,
Ronald

subject: ATTN: Beneficiary Ronald
body:
Dear Ronald, 
 
The reason to open specific account is based on the fact that the payment will be made through the bank which you do not have an account with the bank. 
 
I have explained to you of the process that involves your opening a non resident account with the bank which will only take a period of 3 working days to complete and you receive the payment. 
 
Dr.LEON CILLIAN 
Finance Department Director 
International Monetary Fund 
Phone Number:  (210)489 1168

subject: Re: ATTN: Beneficiary Ronald
body:
Hello Ronald,

Thank you for your email and the detailed explanation. I must say, it's quite interesting to learn about this process of opening a non-resident account with the bank. 

Could you please elaborate more on how this works? For instance, what are the requirements for opening such an account? And once the account is opened, how will I be able to access it?

I'm also curious about the payment process. How exactly will I receive the payment through this new account? Will there be any fees or charges that I should be aware of?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Ronald

subject: Re: ATTN: Beneficiary Ronald
body:
Hello Ronald,

Thank you for your message and the detailed explanation. I must admit, this is all a bit new to me. So, if I understand correctly, I need to open a non-resident account with this specific bank in order to receive the payment? 

Could you please explain a bit more about what a non-resident account is? And why it's necessary for me to open one in this case? Also, could you provide some more information about the process of opening such an account?

I'm sorry for all the questions. As I said, this is all quite new to me and I want to make sure I understand everything correctly.

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Ronald
